intro: Mesona parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered mesona, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Mesona parviflora is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
